data.title: Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga Release Date, Trailer, Cast & Plot
data.meta_description: Curious to know the release date, cast, and plot and watch the trailer for Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga? Read on to know all about it.
data.meta_site_name: ComingSoon.net - Movie Trailers, TV & Streaming News, and More
data.text:
Want to know Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga‘s release date, cast, and plot and also see the trailer? We have you covered. Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga is an upcoming post-apocalyptic action movie directed by George Miller, who also co-produced the film. The film serves as the fifth installment of the Mad Max franchise and is a spin-off and prequel to Mad Max: Fury Road. The film tells the origin story of Imperator Furiosa, a character that first appeared in Mad Max: Fury Road, where she was played by Charlize Theron.

Here’s everything you need to know.

Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga’s release date is May 24, 2024.

The release of Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga happens nearly nine years after that of the previous installment in the Mad Max franchise, Mad Max: Fury Road, which was released on May 15, 2015.

Trailer — watch it now

You can watch the Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga trailer below:

You can also watch the second trailer here. Both trailers showcase what audiences can expect from the film, that being a post-apocalyptic setting on a barren wasteland and a lot of high-octane action sequences and visual effects. The trailers also tease many revelations about Imperator Furiosa’s origin story, including her abduction from the Green Place of Many Mothers by Dementus’ biker horde gang and Furiosa’s subsequent attempts to escape captivity and chart her way back home.

Cast — who is in Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga?

Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga’s cast includes:

Anya Taylor-Joy as Furiosa

Alyla Browne as Young Furiosa

Chris Hemsworth as Warlord Dementus

Tom Burke as Praetorian Jack

Lachy Hulme as Immortan Joe

Angus Sampson as The Organic Mechanic

Nathan Jones as Rictus Erectus

Daniel Webber as War Boy

Charlee Fraser as Mary Jo Bassa

Maleeka Gasbar as Pregnant Wife #1

Nat Buchanan as Pregnant Wife #2

David Collins as Smeg

Ian Roberts as Mr. Harley

Spencer Connelly as Warboy Recruit

Matuse Paz as Fang

Darcy Bryce as Pissboy

Robert Jones as Squint

Alex Time as Dementus Biker

Xanthia Marinelli as Treadmill Rat/Vuvalini

Yeye Zhou as Treadmill Rat

John Howard as The People Eater

Plot – what’s the story about?

The story of Furiosa is about the title character, who after being snatched by Warlord Dementus and his biker gang from The Green Place of Many Mothers in her youth attempts to escape by surviving many trials and plotting a course back home through the wasteland.

While Furiosa is attempting to plot her escape and find the means to do so, she ends up getting caught in the middle of a war between Warlord Dementus and Immortan Joe, for ultimate dominance over the Citadel, which Joe is presiding over. Viewers can expect to see flashbacks chronicling Furiosa’s birth and her early childhood with the people of The Green Place of Many Mothers.
